attributes.action: Reconsider the restrictive price increase in Visa application fees
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently, the cost for a Fiancée or Spouse Visa is £335 by post.
From the 1st of April 2007, the cost jumps to a massive £750!
Other Visa charges are also increasing, as are the consular services in UK embassies and missions abroad.
However, my case today considers solely the exorbitant price increase that the UK Government has placed on foreign nationals from non-EU countries.
It is aimed at excluding the less well off from having their loved ones join them here.
It seeks to stop those from less well off backgrounds in the UK from applying for Visas etc, simply by hiking up the costs involved!
The Government’s policy is aimed at (in their own words) cutting down on illegal immigrants and asylum seekers!
However, it is not those who will be hit by this restrictive tax.
Those that will be affected are the ordinary citizens of the UK who fall in love with a foreign national and who have to foot the bill to have them come to the UK.
Prior to April 2007, the approximate cost to achieve this (including FLR and ILR Visas etc) was £1.000.
From April 2007, this cost will double to around £2000!
